name: In-stream Habitat Complexity & Cover
functionStatement: Channel and floodplain structure supply depth, velocity, substrate diversity, and vegetation to support native organisms through all life stages.
descriptionMarkdown: "Multiple habitat types (riffles/pools/woody debris) exist if historically expected, not unnaturally uniform. Varied substrates (gravel, cobble, wood) provide multiple habitats, unless uniform is normal. Provides shelter unless historically minimal in certain ecoregions."
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Count distinct habitat types (riffle, run, pool, cover) along the reach. Use imagery as a screening aid where needed. Count substrate classes and note presence of wood, leaf packs, and other cover types. Estimate percent of bank length with undercut or overhanging cover during a field visit."

inputs.label: In-stream Habitat Complexity & Cover
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Multiple habitat types well represented. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some variety but key elements are missing. / Mostly uniform with only 1-2 distinct features. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Very uniform channel with limited structural diversity. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: supporting context from imagery and slope.
canopy and bank metrics where available.
